newsitem.title: GERMANY: Villeroy says loss in full-year 1996 inevitable.
newsitem.headline: Villeroy says loss in full-year 1996 inevitable.

text.p: German bathroom fittings and tableware maker Villeroy & Boch said on Thursday that a loss for 1996 was unavoidable but that it expects to post positive results in 1997.

"Profit-boosting and other necessary measures introduced by the company are combined with extraordinary charges and mean that a loss in full-year 1996 looks inevitable," the company said in a compulsory statement.
The company said it was confident that the measures it had taken would lead to a clearly higher result in 1997 and would secure satisfactory earnings capabilities in 1998.
Villeroy says loss in full-year 1996 inevitable=2
Villeroy reported a pre-tax loss of 10.4 million marks ($6.8 million) in the first nine months of the year, compared to a pre-tax profit of 50.2 million marks in the same period last year.

"The unsatisfactory development in earnings is primarily due to a fall in sales in the high-earning bathroom fittings sector, and a successful programme of cost reduction was not enough to compensate in the period," the group said.
In the nine month period, total sales fell by 3.1 percent to 1.08 billion marks, with the group's bathroom division registering a 12.4 percent fall in turnover to 353.1 million marks.

"Rationalisation programmes will take place in all areas of activity, to improve the earnings capability of Villeroy & Boch. The sale of the Bamberg unit and the capacity reduction at Torgau are real steps in this direction," the company said.
